item.title: Increase Terminal Size Font of 4k Device
item.description: When booting a new Linux install on a 4k HiDPI screen the terminal font size becomes so small that it is near impossible to read. In order to increase the font size i found this neat little setting that does just that, now you can read your terminal before you startx. Edit /etc/vconsole.conf and add/replace with the following to get larger font on the next boot. FONT=latarcyrheb-sun32
